ğŸ“ AWS Auto Scaling
âš™ï¸ AWS CloudFormation
ğŸ§± AWS Config
ğŸ“¦ AWS Systems Manager

ğŸ’¡ Auto Scaling automatically adjusts capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost.

â“ What is the primary purpose of AWS CloudTrail? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Audit and compliance logging
âš™ï¸ Cost optimization
ğŸ§± Performance monitoring
ğŸ“¦ Security scanning

ğŸ’¡ CloudTrail provides a complete audit trail of all API calls made to your AWS account, essential for compliance and security monitoring.

â“ Which AWS service is used for serverless database operations? ğŸŸ¢

ğŸ“ Amazon DynamoDB
âš™ï¸ Amazon RDS
ğŸ§± Amazon ElastiCache
ğŸ“¦ Amazon Redshift

ğŸ’¡ DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service that scales automatically and requires no server management.

â“ What does AWS Lambda use to package your code? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Deployment packages (.zip files)
âš™ï¸ Docker containers
ğŸ§± AMI images
ğŸ“¦ Snapshots

ğŸ’¡ Lambda uses deployment packages (ZIP files) to package your code and dependencies for execution.

ğŸ“ Amazon EKS
âš™ï¸ Amazon ECS
ğŸ§± Amazon EC2
ğŸ“¦ Amazon Fargate

ğŸ’¡ EKS (Elastic Kubernetes Service) provides managed Kubernetes clusters that are fully compatible with standard Kubernetes.

ğŸ“ Private connection to AWS services
âš™ï¸ Load balancing
ğŸ§± Auto scaling
ğŸ“¦ Cost optimization

ğŸ’¡ VPC endpoints allow you to privately connect your VPC to supported AWS services without using internet gateways or NAT devices.

ğŸ§± Amazon EKS
ğŸ“¦ Amazon EC2

ğŸ’¡ Fargate is a serverless compute engine that runs containers without requiring you to manage underlying EC2 instances.

ğŸ“ Amazon EFS
âš™ï¸ Amazon S3
ğŸ§± Amazon EBS
ğŸ“¦ Amazon Glacier

ğŸ’¡ EFS (Elastic File System) provides managed file storage that can be mounted on multiple EC2 instances.

â“ What does AWS WAF protect against? ğŸŸ¡

ğŸ“ Web application attacks
âš™ï¸ Network attacks
ğŸ§± DDoS attacks
ğŸ“¦ Malware infections

ğŸ’¡ WAF (Web Application Firewall) protects web applications from common web exploits and attacks.
